reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am African American with curly hair. I was hesitant to buy this as I couldnt find reviews by black women but I tried it anyway and am very glad I did. Many times products that are marketed for all hair types don't work for my hair but this conditioner and shampoo did. I used it twice before reviewing so I could be sure my first use wasn't a fluke. The shampoo cleaned my hair without stripping or tangling. I have avoided products even labeled as shampoo for the last few years because my hair gets so tangled but this didn't do that. But it's the conditioner that suprised me most. Again, conditioners marketed for everyone tend to not moisturize enough or help with detailing. This soaked into my hair easily, my hair detangled easily and afterwards it felt light/not weighed down but not dry at all...and that moisture stayed with my hair throughout the week. I also have been struggling with thinning hair and tons of shedding. I am in my 40s and perimenopausal. The second time washing my hair with these products I had 1/3 the shedding both in shower and during blowdrying and flatironing. This may be shampoo and conditioner but I am also using their scalp serum each night. For additional context for curly women, my hair is small s curls; thin strands but lots of strands; highly porous; waist length when straight. When straightening hair I wash, blowdry and flatiron only once a week. I used this for my straightening routine so can't speak to slip/detangling when I wear curly in the summer but I plan to try it out when I do wear it curly.

reviews.review_text: I bought this and the shampoo thru the Necessaire website but I feel like it's more helpful to leave reviews here. Not only does this have the National Eczema Association Seal of Approval but the company also holds themselves to the ingredient standards of the EU which is way more strict than the US. I have oily roots with dry ends and a flaky/irritated scalp. I apply this heavily on my ends and then take whatever little is left on my hands and run it through my roots, and while it's not an overnight cure (one of the hero ingredients, Niacinamide, can take up to 12 weeks to fully work) slowly the flakes and inflammation are going down. I really do think the panthenol and hyaluronic acid are helping with moisture retention and strength in my ends. It doesn't have any weird smell that you sometimes get in other fragrance free natural products. The biggest pros are that this company has an entire line of fragrance free clean products which streamlines my routine, and then the aesthetic is beautiful.
